content: Hey @Amanieu or @Josh Triplett or others -- could one of you post an update on rust-lang/rust#72016 in advance of the lang team planning meeting at 2021-04-07T13:00:00-04:00? (I imagine there may not have been any major updates since the last time...)
@Amanieu, last time this came up, you had a fairly detailed list of what does and doesn't need to happen before stabilization. Do you have a current version of that list?
The two main issues on that list: handling clobbers and handling labels are still unresolved.
Does label handling need to happen before stabilization?
Honestly labels is easier than clobbers because we actually have a design for it.
I'm still not sure how to handle clobbers.
Which aspect of clobbers? Things like clobbering all C calling convention registers seem easy enough.
Sure, that one's easy. We still need to decide on a syntax for it.
(Just like LLVM could and really should do, unless I'm missing something here...)
Hey folks! Could somebody post a status update to https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/72016 for the lang team planning meeting next Wednesday? Thanks!

Hey all!

The lang team is holding the next planning meeting on July 7th (next week), and is looking for updates from the active projects. Please leave one on the tracking issue - https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/72016 (looks like there's not one on the lang-team repo itself)

Good questions to consider:

  • What are recent topics of discussion?
  • Any exciting developments since the last check-in?
  • Any points where the group is stuck and the lang-team could weigh in?
  • Any potential design meeting topics?
  • Any other concerns?

No worries if there's not been any significant progress since the last update.

cc @Amanieu @Josh Triplett
@Amanieu @Josh Triplett re-asking for the update -- I'm not seeing one on the issue just yet.
